thread.title: Houses evacuated in fast-moving Wanaka scrub fire
thread.title_full: Houses evacuated in fast-moving Wanaka scrub fire

title: Houses evacuated in fast-moving Wanaka scrub fire
text:
Houses evacuated in fast-moving Wanaka scrub fire Last updated 19:14, February 24 2017 SIMON MAUDE/FAIRFAX NZ 
Fire crews are battling a scrub fire in Wanaka. 
Two houses have been evacuated because of a fast-moving scrub fire in Wanaka. 
Fire communications shift manager Andrew Norris said the properties were evacuated as a precaution as a blaze in Dublin Bay neared the homes. 
Two helicopters with monsoon buckets, four trucks and two tankers were fighting the fire. 
Are you affected? Email us at 
Norris said the blaze was "not yet contained, but the crew are quite happy with the resources there". 
The fire started just before 6pm and was about 500 metres wide, he said. 
Wanaka resident Sarah Veaseyâ€‹ said she had taken her two young children for a swim in the lake when she spotted smoke billowing through the trees. 
She said a few other families had been swimming nearby and they had all hurried out of the water and called for the fire brigade. 
"In a few minutes the wind had picked up and the fire had really taken off. There were huge flames and the kids were starting to get quite scared and freak out a bit, so I thought it was best not to stay around and try and help. 
"A couple of big gusts of wind came through and it got pretty bad really fast. The flames were already 10 to 20m high, so I called [the] fire [service] again and told them they better bring another truck." 
Veasey said the blaze started right by the beach near two baches and was moving back quickly towards two houses. - Stuff
